The Secretary of State is authorized to participate in the Regional Emerging Diseases Intervention Center (REDI Center) in Singapore. Prior consultation with congressional committees is required, and reports on bioterrorism efforts at the REDI Center must be submitted annually. The Agreement mentioned is between the United States and another government. The Agreement between the United States and Singapore establishes the Regional Emerging Diseases Intervention Center in Singapore on November 22, 2005. The Foreign Service Act of 1980 is amended to allow reimbursements for medical care abroad to be credited to the appropriate appropriation account and available for expenditure in the fiscal year received. Additionally, accountability review boards are established. The Diplomatic Security Act is amended to include limited exemptions for incidents in Afghanistan and Iraq, allowing the Secretary of State to bypass convening a Board for certain incidents involving serious injury, loss of life, or significant property damage during a specified period. Reporting requirements are also outlined for such incidents. The Secretary of State is required to promptly notify specific committees in the House of Representatives and Senate, conduct an inquiry, and submit a report on findings and recommendations related to incidents in Afghanistan and Iraq under limited exemptions outlined in the Diplomatic Security Act. SEC. 4. INCREASED LIMITS APPLICABLE TO POST DIFFERENTIALS AND DANGER PAY ALLOWANCES. Repeal of limited-scope effective date for previous increase in post differentials and danger pay allowances under title 5, United States Code. Amendments made to increase danger pay allowances to 35 percent of basic pay for employees. The Secretary of State will inform relevant committees of the criteria for adjustments in post differentials and danger pay allowances. A study will assess the impact of these adjustments on filling hard-to-fill positions, with a report due within two years. The Secretary of State will report to the House and Senate committees on Government Reform and Homeland Security regarding adjustments in post differentials and danger pay allowances. SEC. 5 amends procedures for the Foreign Service Grievance Board, clarifying involuntary separation considerations. SEC. 6 extends the Personal Services Contracting Pilot Program. SEC. 7 allows advance funds for official residence expenses. SEC. 8 addresses education benefits in the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands. Section 305(a) of the United States International Broadcasting Act of 1994 is amended to provide for payment of school expenses and transportation for dependents of personnel stationed in the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands. The United States International Broadcasting Act of 1994 is amended to provide school expenses and transportation for dependents of personnel in the Northern Mariana Islands where schools are not accessible by public transportation.
